intro: Rostellularia media, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowroot, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Araceae. It is characterized by its large, arrow-shaped leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in length. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are typically hidden within a spadix, a common feature in the Araceae family. Its rhizomes are edible and have a starchy texture similar to that of taro. Rostellularia media is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as for its culinary uses in certain regions.
